alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 4:45PM MST until September 02 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST FOR AREAS NEAR THE WAVE...COYOTE VALLEY...AND COYOTE WASH THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 442 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain IN Coyote Valley and The Wave across the western portion of the Vermilion Cliffs. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding...including debris flows of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads remains possible through the evening, even though the heaviest rain has moved off. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cottonwood Teepees Trailhead, White Pocket, Rainbow Valley Trailhead, The Wave, Stateline Campground, Paria River Slot Canyon and Vermilion Cliffs National Monument. This includes the following hiking areas, creeks, washes and rivers... The Wave, Vermilion Cliffs, the Paria River, House Rock Wash and Coyote Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even if the heaviest rainfall has ended or is occurring in the distance. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
